column2: NEBRASKA DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: Shopping centre ahead.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 2. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column8: can handle

column2: 3. When you approach this sign, you must:
column8: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 4. Enter a roundabout:
column4: when you have a green light.
column6: after coming to a complete stop and looking both ways.
column8: only when there is a safe gap in traffic.

column2: 5. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column6: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column8: stare straight ahead at all times.
column10: maintain focus toward the left of the road.

column2: 6. You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you must:
column4: look to see if another train is coming, then cross the tracks if it is safe to do so.
column6: watch for vehicles that must stop at railroad crossings (school buses, vehicles carrying hazardous materials, etc.).
column8: All of the above.

column2: 7. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column6: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.
column8: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column8: Warning: sharp left turn ahead.

column2: 9. If you change your name or address you must apply to the County Treasurer for a replacement operators license within ___ days.
10. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column8: the road is narrower ahead.

column2: 11. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
column6: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.
column8: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.

column2: 12. You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.
column8: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.

column2: 13. Drivers who refuse to submit to a chemical test for alcohol or drugs will have their license suspended for:
column8: 30 days.

column2: 14. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column6: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 15. A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
column8: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 16. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column8: Round

column2: 17. Drivers who flee to avoid arrest:
column4: could have their operators license revoked.
column6: can be charged with a misdemeanor or felony offense.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 18. A flashing red light means:
column8: The same as a STOP sign.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 19. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
20. This sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a low place in the road.
column8: a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 22. Barricades, drums, cones and vertical panels are the most commonly used devices to guide drivers safely through a work zone.
23. When the pavement is marked with a double yellow line, drivers may pass other vehicles:
column6: only if there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: only if the vehicle ahead is driving 10 mph or more under the speed limit.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 24. A work zone:
column4: does not require that the driver slow down and pay extra attention.
column6: might involve vehicles and moving workers.
column8: is marked with black and white signs.

column2: 25. Alcohol:
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
